data.title: Historically lovely
data.text:
There are several parts of this which the public doesn't ever get to experience. The 3rd floor library, while exceedingly creepy, houses very old and rare books. 

Washington's Lodge, on the 5th floor, is probably the most eccentric and lovely. However, very few, if any, will ever get to see this room.

Perhaps if you ask, they may tell you about the ghosts, too.

data.title: Wonderful lunch
data.text: This is a great place to have a simple but delicious lunch and the homemade pies are delicious. The prices are just perfect, I eat here several times a month and will make the trip to Flint just to come here.

data.title: Famous Sunday Chicken Dinner Buffets
data.text: The Masonic Temple is a "local secret" for dining. It is across from the courthouse and you will see many members of the legal community enjoying a meal at lunch. Judges, lawyers and jury members are regulars. Prices are super low and food is homemade and of good quality. Menu changes every day. They are not open on weekends except for regularly scheduled buffet chicken dinners that are sponsored as fundraisers for local non profits. They are also known for homemade pie!!

data.title: Best Lunch in Flint
data.text: I frequent the Masonic Temple at least 2-3 times a month when I am downtown during lunch time. The lunches are simple, and you get a good deal for the dollar.

data.title: Battista's makes this the place to be
data.text: Excellent food for the best lunch in town. Wonderful service, great atmosphere, I can't say enough good about this place. The prices are perfect too. I only wish that they were open for dinner.

data.title: Great Food, Great Staff
data.text: The Masonic Temple can't be beat! I've been there multiple times and I continue to do so. The food is amazing, especially their chicken and homemade macaroni. The staff is wonderful and always smiling. If your in flint and looking for a good place to eat at I definitely recommend the Masonic Temple!

data.title: good food
data.text: food is good but nobody knowns they serve food and no parking

data.title: Theater trip disaster
data.text: Had 10 tickets for a musical. Seats were scattered all over the theater. Asked for elevator for aged Aunt and was told there was none. After she climbed the stairs to the 2nd row from the top we saw the elevator about 10 feet from our seats. WIll never return!!!!!!

data.title: Interesting Old Building
data.text: The Masonic Temple was dedicated 100 years ago, and is an interesting place to visit.  Nice dining room in lower level with traditional fare.  Main level has a large event hall and stage.
